page.title: 07Landscape (contd.)
page.content: to the physical nature of the country. The flatter valley lands are mainly used for growing crops and the higher land with steep slopes is mainly laid to grass. However this does not fully explain the high incidence of pasture land in the Southeastern corner of the area. The farms in this area are mainly smallholdings that utilise the pasture lands of Twyford Common and surrounding district. Farms in the valley lands on either side of Norton Brook tend to concentrate upon crop farming utilising larger, flatter fields than elsewhere in the area. Two notable exceptions to the pattern of arable land are found at Veddoes Farm and Grafton Villa where pastoral farming dominates the land-use pattern due to an adherence to tradition and familiar practices over a number of years. It is now very noticeable that
